description:
Computes the arc cosine of `x`. The arc cosine is the inverse function of the cosine so that *`arccos(cos(x)) = x`*.

Works on radians only.
The no-data value `null` is passed through and therefore gets propagated. `NaN` is returned for values outside of the allowed range.

returns.description: The computed angle in radians in the range *[0, Ï€]*.

links.title: Inverse cosine explained by Wolfram MathWorld
